parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.22

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Vehicle Inventory

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns array of all containers (uniforms, vests, backpacks) stored in given crate or vehicle. Used for accessing containers content stored in ammo box or ground holder.

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''everyContainer''' object

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> object: [[Object]] - Vehicle or ammo box
</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Array]]

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[everyContainer]] [[cursorTarget]];</code>
<ext><name>pre</name><attr/><inner>[
	["V_PlateCarrier1_rgr",2bc06b00# 163955: dummyweapon.p3d],
	["U_B_CombatUniform_mcam",2bc07900# 163954: dummyweapon.p3d]
]</inner><close></pre></close></ext>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[everyBackpack]], [[uniformContainer]], [[vestContainer]], [[backpackContainer]]
</value></part></template>

<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on July 20, 2017 - 12:07 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Yuval|Yuval]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
The returned array is in the following format:<br>
<code>[
    [containerClassname1, containerObject1],
    [containerClassname2, containerObject2],
    ....
    [containerClassnameN, containerObjectN]
]
</code>
Please do note that [[typeOf]] containerObjectN '''does not''' return containerClassnameN but rather the containerClass configured in config (usually "supplyN")

</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes --></comment></root>
